laazotea.indi.client

Class INDIProperty

  • java.lang.Object
    • laazotea.indi.client.INDIProperty
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    INDIBLOBProperty, INDILightProperty, INDINumberProperty, INDISwitchProperty, INDITextProperty

    public abstract class INDIProperty
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing a INDI Property. The subclasses INDIBLOBProperty, INDILightProperty, INDINumberProperty, INDISwitchProperty and INDITextProperty define the basic Properties that a INDI Devices may contain according to the INDI protocol.

    It implements a listener mechanism to notify changes in its Elements.

    Version:
    1.32, January 27, 2013
    Author:
    S. Alonso (Zerjillo) [zerjioi at ugr.es]

    • Constructor Detail

      • INDIProperty

        protected INDIProperty(org.w3c.dom.Element xml,
            INDIDevice device)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs an instance of INDIProperty. Called by its sub-classes. INDIPropertys are not usually directly instantiated. Usually used by INDIDevice.
        Parameters:
        xml - A XML Element <defXXXVector> describing the Property.
        device - The INDIDevice to which this Property belongs.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the XML Property is not well formed (does not contain a name attribute or the permissions are not correct).

    • Method Detail

      • update

        protected abstract void update(org.w3c.dom.Element xml)
        Updates the values of its elements according to some XML data. Subclasses of INDIProperty must implement this method to really do the parsing and update (usually calling update(Element, String)).
        Parameters:
        xml - A XML Element <setXXXVector> to which the property must be updated.
        See Also:
        update(Element, String)

      • update

        protected void update(org.w3c.dom.Element xml,
          java.lang.String childNodesType)
        Updates the values of its elements according to some XML data. Subclasses of INDIProperty usually call this method from update(Element) to really do the parsing and update.
        Parameters:
        xml - A XML Element <setXXXVector> to which the property must be updated.
        childNodesType - The real XML type of xml, that is, one of <setBLOBVector>, <setLightVector>, <setNumberVector>, <setSwitchVector> or <setTextVector>.
        See Also:
        update(Element)

      • sendChangesToDriver

        public void sendChangesToDriver()
                         throws INDIValueException,
                                java.io.IOException
        Tests and changes the desired values of the the Elements of this Property. If there are new desired values for any Elements the XML code to produce the change is sent to the INDI Driver. If communication is successful the state of the property is set to "Busy".
        Throws:
        INDIValueException - if some of the desired values are not correct or if the Property is Read Only.
        java.io.IOException - if there is some communication problem with the INDI driver connection.

      • addINDIPropertyListener

        public void addINDIPropertyListener(INDIPropertyListener listener)
        Adds a new listener to this Property.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to be added.

      • getDefaultUIComponent

        public abstract INDIPropertyListener getDefaultUIComponent()
                                                    throws laazotea.indi.INDIException
        Gets a default UI component to handle the repesentation and control of this Property. The panel is registered as a listener of this Property. Please note that the UI class must implement INDIPropertyListener. The component will be chosen depending on the loaded UI libraries (I4JClientUI, I4JAndroid, etc). Note that a casting of the returned value must be done. If a previous default component has been requested, the previous one will be deregistered. So, only one default component will listen for the property.
        Returns:
        A UI component that handles this Property.
        Throws:
        laazotea.indi.INDIException

      • getElementNames

        public java.lang.String[] getElementNames()

        a String representation of the property and its values.

      • getValuesAsString

        Returns:
